com.extjs.gxt.ui.client.store
Class Store<C extends BaseLoadConfig>

java.lang.Object
  com.extjs.gxt.ui.client.util.Observable
      com.extjs.gxt.ui.client.store.Store<C>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Loader
public class Store<C extends BaseLoadConfig>
extends Observable
implements Loader

The Store class encapsulates a client side cache of Record objects which provide input data for Components such as the ComboBox and DataView

Events:
DataChange : StoreEvent(store)
Fires when the data cache has changed, and a widget which is using this Store as a Record cache should refresh its view.
  • store : this
Add : StoreEvent(store, records, index)
Fires when Records have been added to the Store.
  • store : this
  • records : the added records
  • index : the index at which the record(s) were added
Remove : StoreEvent(store, record)
Fires when a Record has been removed from the Store.
  • store : this
  • record : the record that was removed
  • index : the index at which the record was removed
Update : StoreEvent(store, record)
Fires when a Record has been updated.
  • store : this
  • record : the record that was updated
  • operation : the update operation being performed. Value may be one of: EDIT, REJECT, COMMIT.
Clear : StoreEvent(store)
Fires when the data cache has been cleared.
  • store : this
BeforeLoad : StoreEvent(store, options)
Fires before a request is made for a new data object.
  • store : this
  • option : the loading options that were specified (see load() for details)
Load : StoreEvent(store, records, options)
Fires after a new set of Records has been loaded.
  • store : this
  • records : the records that were loaded
  • options : the loading options that were specified (see load() for details)
LoadException : StoreEvent(store)
Fires after a new set of Records has been loaded.
  • store : this

clearFilters

public void clearFilters(boolean supressEvent)
Revert to a view of this store with no filtering applied.

Parameters:
supressEvent - if true the filter is cleared silently without notifying listeners

commitChanges

public void commitChanges()
Commit all Records with outstanding changes. To handle updates for changes, subscribe to the Store's Update event, and perform updating when the operation parameter is Record.COMMIT.

getAt

public Record getAt(int index)
Get the Record at the specified index.

Parameters:
index - the index of the record to find
Returns:
the record at the passed index

getCount

public int getCount()
Gets the number of cached records.

If using paging, this may not be the total size of the dataset. If the data object used by the Reader contains the dataset size, then the getTotalCount() function returns the dataset size.

Returns:
the number of Records in the Store's cache.

getModifiedRecords

public java.util.List<Record> getModifiedRecords()
Gets all records modified since the last commit. Modified records are persisted across load operations (e.g., during paging).

Returns:
a list of modified records

getTotalCount

public int getTotalCount()
Gets the total number of records in the dataset as returned by the server.

If using paging, for this to be accurate, the data object used by the Reader must contain the dataset size. For remote data sources, this is provided by a query on the server.

Returns:
the number of records as passed from the server

Returns:

insert

public java.util.List<Record> insert(java.util.List<? extends ModelData> records,
                                     int index)
Inserts the model to the Store at the given index and fires the Add event.

The input can contain anything that extends ModelStorage.

If the input element is not a Record, it will be wrapped in a Record.

Parameters:
records - the records to insert
index - the insert location

insert

public Record insert(ModelData model,
                     int index)
Inserts the model to the Store at the given index and fires the Add event.

If the model is not a Record it will be wapped in a record

Parameters:
model - the record to insert
index - the insert location

sort

public void sort(java.lang.String fieldName,
                 int dir)
Sort the Records.

If remote sorting is used, the sort is performed on the server, and the cache is reloaded. If local sorting is used, the cache is sorted internally.

Parameters:
fieldName -
dir -
